paper.name: Chain-of-Thought Empowers Transformers
paper.prompt:
Create a flowchart diagram comparing serial vs parallel reasoning in transformers.

Include these key elements:
- Parallel reasoning path: Multiple computations happening simultaneously
- Serial reasoning path: Sequential step-by-step processing with CoT
- Performance comparison: Show accuracy and complexity trade-offs
- Transformer architecture: Attention mechanisms and feed-forward networks
- Decision point: When to use serial vs parallel reasoning

Use a side-by-side comparison layout. Green for serial reasoning, blue for parallel. Show clear performance metrics.

diagrams.code:
direction right
// Title
title Serial vs Parallel Reasoning in Transformers

// Decision node
Choose Reasoning Strategy [shape: diamond, color: gray]

// Side-by-side groups
Serial Path [color: green] {
  Serial Start [shape: oval, color: lightgreen]
  Transformer Architecture Serial [shape: rectangle]
  Chain of Thought Reasoning [shape: rectangle, color: lightgreen]
  Attention Mechanism Serial [shape: rectangle]
  Feed Forward Network Serial [shape: rectangle]
  Accuracy 90 Percent [shape: rectangle, color: lightgreen]
  Complexity High [shape: rectangle, color: lightgreen]
  Serial End [shape: oval, color: lightgreen]
}

Parallel Path [color: blue] {
  Parallel Start [shape: oval, color: lightblue]
  Transformer Architecture Parallel [shape: rectangle]
  Simultaneous Computations [shape: rectangle, color: lightblue]
  Attention Mechanism Parallel [shape: rectangle]
  Feed Forward Network Parallel [shape: rectangle]
  Accuracy 85 Percent [shape: rectangle, color: lightblue]
  Complexity Medium [shape: rectangle, color: lightblue]
  Parallel End [shape: oval, color: lightblue]
}

// Connections
Choose Reasoning Strategy > Serial Start: High Accuracy [color: green]
Choose Reasoning Strategy > Parallel Start: High Throughput [color: blue]

Serial Start > Transformer Architecture Serial
Transformer Architecture Serial > Chain of Thought Reasoning
Chain of Thought Reasoning > Attention Mechanism Serial
Attention Mechanism Serial > Feed Forward Network Serial
Feed Forward Network Serial > Accuracy 90 Percent
Accuracy 90 Percent > Complexity High
Complexity High > Serial End

Parallel Start > Transformer Architecture Parallel
Transformer Architecture Parallel > Simultaneous Computations
Simultaneous Computations > Attention Mechanism Parallel
Attention Mechanism Parallel > Feed Forward Network Parallel
Feed Forward Network Parallel > Accuracy 85 Percent
Accuracy 85 Percent > Complexity Medium
Complexity Medium > Parallel End
